term.name: sensualism
term.source: From Latin sensualis: relating to the senses of perception.
term.def: A form of &hedonism; that emphasizes the pleasures of the senses or of the body as opposed to the pleasures of the mind (as in &rationalism;). For example, &epicureanism; was opposed to the ancient Cyrenaic philosophers, who claimed that sensual pleasures are superior to intellectual or emotional pleasures.
